sen.j: 道中奉行（どうちゅうぶぎょう）は、江戸幕府における職名のひとつ。
sen.e: Dochu-bugyo was a governmental post in the Edo bakufu.
Dochu-bugyo was a governmental post in the Edo bakufu.
Dochu-bugyo was a governmental post in the Edo bakufu.

sen.j: 五街道とその付属街道における宿場駅の取締り、助郷の監督、道路・橋梁など道中関係全てを担当した。
sen.e: The officers in this post were in charge of all road-related affairs, including the control of Shukuba-eki (inn-concentrated towns) along the five main roads and their branched roads, the supervision of Sukego (road-related laborers gathered from villages around such a town), and the states of roads and of bridges.

sen.j: 初見は『吏徴別録』の寛永4年（1632年）12月にある水野守信ら4名の任命の記事である
sen.e: The description in "Richobetsuroku" that four persons, including Morinobu MIZUNO, were appointed to the post in December of 1632 (in the old calendar) was the first historical record of the post.

sen.j: が、一般的には万治2年7月19日 (旧暦)（1659年9月5日）に大目付高木守久が兼任で就任したのにはじまるとされる。
sen.e: However, Ometuske (a governmental officer watching movements of the Imperial court, etc.) Morihisa TAKAGI was appointed to this post additionally in September 5, 1659, and it is generally said that this was the first appointment to this post.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処高木守久： 正しい読み、不明です。
sen.e: However, Ometsuke (a governmental officer watching movements of the Imperial court, etc.) Morihisa TAKAGI was appointed to this post additionally in September 5, 1659, and it is generally said that this was the first appointment to this post.
sen.cmt: 高木守久： 正しい読み、不明です。Ometuske誤字のため訂正。

sen.j: 大目付兼帯1名として始まったが、元禄11年（1698年）に勘定奉行松平重良が道中奉行加役となっった。
sen.e: This post started with an officer who was also Ometsuke, but in 1698, was also assumed by Kanjo-bugyo (a governmental officer in charge of financial affairs) Shigeyoshi MATSUDAIRA additionally.

sen.j: それ以後、大目付と勘定奉行から1名ずつ兼帯する2人制となった。
sen.e: After that, two officers, an Ometsuke officer and a Kanjo-bugyo officer assumed the post additionally.

sen.j: 弘化2年（1845年）より大目付のみの兼帯。
sen.e: In 1845 and later, only an Ometsuke officer became to assume the post additionally.

sen.j: その役料は享保8年（1723年）から年に3000石、文化 (元号)2年（1805年）以後は年間金250両。
sen.e: A 3,000 koku of rice crop (approx. 180 liters/koku) was provided for the post yearly from 1723, and 250 ryo (a monetary unit at that time) in gold yearly in 1805 and later.
